Description: Shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery dinos; six sherds forming three non-joining fragments. Pale orange clay with white inclusions. Inside reserved; exterior, traces of cream slip: tongues at neck join above animal frieze between bands with superimposed added red bands lined in white; from left, lion facing goat, lion to left, lion facing goat, seated sphinx to right; added red on mane of lions, on haunch and lower belly of wild goats and on haunch of sphinx; inscription cut on upper dividing band.
Curator's comments: Published by A. Johnston, 'Trading families?', in R. Catling (ed.), Onomatologos (Essays in Honour of Elaine Matthews), Oxford 2010, 474-477. The missing sherd in Gardner's drawing has appeared on the antiquties market (e-bay, May 2019; it shows that the reconstruction of the sherds in the BM is wrong.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pp. 65, no. 779, pl. XXI, no. 779)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 685, no. 433)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.403)
Condition: The arrangement of the sherds in the current restoration is wrong in view of: the matching of the wheel-marks on the interior, the matching of the animals in the frieze to the graffito, and the addition of the rediscovered fragment
